seg-source.mrk: Turning on the trace facility

target.mrk: Turning on the trace facility

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to turn on the trace facility.

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to turn on the trace facility.

target.mrk: Follow these steps to turn on the trace facility.

trans-unit.source: Turn on tracing for all sessions by specifying the following property:

seg-source.mrk: Turn on tracing for all sessions by specifying the following property:

target.mrk: Turn on tracing for all sessions by specifying the following property:

seg-source.mrk: derby.drda.traceAll=true

target.mrk: derby.drda.traceAll=true

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="radminconfig.dita#radminconfig"></xref> for information on this property.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="radminconfig.dita#radminconfig"></xref> for information on this property.

target.mrk: See <xref href="radminconfig.dita#radminconfig"></xref> for information on this property.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, while the Network Server is running, you can use the following command (all on one line) to turn on the trace facility:

seg-source.mrk: Alternatively, while the Network Server is running, you can use the following command (all on one line) to turn on the trace facility:

target.mrk: Alternatively, while the Network Server is running, you can use the following command (all on one line) to turn on the trace facility:

seg-source.mrk: java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl trace on [-s connection-number] [-h hostname][-p portnumber]

target.mrk: java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl trace on [-s connection-number] [-h hostname][-p portnumber]

trans-unit.source: If you specify a connection-number, tracing will be turned on only for that connection.

seg-source.mrk: If you specify a connection-number, tracing will be turned on only for that connection.

target.mrk: If you specify a connection-number, tracing will be turned on only for that connection.

trans-unit.source: Set the location of the tracing files by specifying the following property:

seg-source.mrk: Set the location of the tracing files by specifying the following property:

target.mrk: Set the location of the tracing files by specifying the following property:

seg-source.mrk: derby.drda.traceDirectory=directory-for-tracing-files

target.mrk: derby.drda.traceDirectory=directory-for-tracing-files

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="radminconfigdb2jdrdatracedirectory.dita#radminconfigdb2jdrdatracedirectory"></xref> for information on this property.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="radminconfigdb2jdrdatracedirectory.dita#radminconfigdb2jdrdatracedirectory"></xref> for information on this property.

target.mrk: See <xref href="radminconfigdb2jdrdatracedirectory.dita#radminconfigdb2jdrdatracedirectory"></xref> for information on this property.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, while the Network Server is running, use the following command (all on one line) to set the trace directory:

seg-source.mrk: Alternatively, while the Network Server is running, use the following command (all on one line) to set the trace directory:

target.mrk: Alternatively, while the Network Server is running, use the following command (all on one line) to set the trace directory:

seg-source.mrk: java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl traceDirectory directory-for-tracing-files [-h hostname] [-p portnumber]

target.mrk: java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl traceDirectory directory-for-tracing-files [-h hostname] [-p portnumber]

trans-unit.source: You need to specify only the directory where the tracing files will reside. The names of the tracing files are determined by the system. If you do not set a trace directory, the tracing files will be placed in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: You need to specify only the directory where the tracing files will reside.
The names of the tracing files are determined by the system.
If you do not set a trace directory, the tracing files will be placed in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>.

target.mrk: You need to specify only the directory where the tracing files will reside.
The names of the tracing files are determined by the system.
If you do not set a trace directory, the tracing files will be placed in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: The Network Server will attempt to create the trace directory (and any parent directories) if they do not exist. This will require that the Java security policy for <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> permits verification of the existence of the named trace directory and all necessary parent directories. For each directory created, the policy must allow

seg-source.mrk: The Network Server will attempt to create the trace directory (and any parent directories) if they do not exist.
This will require that the Java security policy for <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> permits verification of the existence of the named trace directory and all necessary parent directories.
For each directory created, the policy must allow

target.mrk: The Network Server will attempt to create the trace directory (and any parent directories) if they do not exist.
This will require that the Java security policy for <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> permits verification of the existence of the named trace directory and all necessary parent directories.
For each directory created, the policy must allow

seg-source.mrk: permission java.io.FilePermission "directory", "read,write";

target.mrk: permission java.io.FilePermission "directory", "read,write";

trans-unit.source: For the trace directory itself, the policy must allow

seg-source.mrk: For the trace directory itself, the policy must allow

target.mrk: For the trace directory itself, the policy must allow

seg-source.mrk: permission java.io.FilePermission "tracedirectory${/}-", "write";

target.mrk: permission java.io.FilePermission "tracedirectory${/}-", "write";

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="tadminnetservcustom.dita#tadminnetservcustom"></xref> for information about customizing the Network Server's security policy.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="tadminnetservcustom.dita#tadminnetservcustom"></xref> for information about customizing the Network Server's security policy.

target.mrk: See <xref href="tadminnetservcustom.dita#tadminnetservcustom"></xref> for information about customizing the Network Server's security policy.
